title: Real estate agent Clay Chigwidden glassed man at Coogee Pavilion then ran away from bouncers
text:
A young real estate agent glassed a man in the face on the dance floor at Sydney's Coogee Pavilion before running away from bouncers.

Clay Chigwidden, 26, was intoxicated and 'dancing in a manner that encroached on other patrons' space' when he pushed a man in the chest at the Eastern Suburbs bar on June 9.

The man, who is not known to Chigwidden, tried to protect himself but was suddenly glassed.

Clay Chigwidden, 26, pushed a random man in the chest and glassed him in the face on the Coogee Pavilion dancefloor in June

The Century 21 real estate agent then fled from bouncers through a fire exit, which caused one of the bouncers to fall over and injure his leg

He sustained serious facial injuries to his left eye that required surgery.

Security guards tried to separate the pair but Chigwidden refused to tell bouncers who he was.

He then fled through a fire exit, which caused one of the bouncers to fall over and injure his leg.

Police managed to track down Chigwidden three days later and charged him with reckless wounding, but he refused to be interviewed, the Daily Telegraph reported.

Police managed to track down Chigwidden three days later and charged him with reckless wounding, but he refused to be interviewed

They allege the muscular real estate agent's actions 'have been for his own self preservation.'

Police also claimed he 'has attempted to conceal his identity from police to prevent him from being held accountable.'

Chigwidden faced Waverley Local Court on Tuesday and pleaded guilty to wreckless wounding.

Court documents reveal Chigwidden had previously been charged with assault, possessing a prohibited drug and driving under the influence.

He will be sentenced in November.
